Information about the position

Politecnico di Milano is seeking candidates with strong research potential, interested in developing new optic-based systems for parameters monitoring in the field of healthcare. The research project aims at the design of optoelectronics and fiber optic-based systems to be used for continuous monitoring of the human health and related quantities (e.g., biosensing, environmental monitoring).

Experience with fiber optic systems is required, and knowledge of optical fiber for laser systems is considered a plus.

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on a unique interdisciplinary project, in cooperation with active and international research team.

The project will be carried out in the Department of Mechanical Engineering (DMEC) of Politecnico di Milano.

The position is funded by the Grant LASEROPTIMAL@POLIMI.

Information about the research team:

Further information on the project is available at the link: http://www.laseroptimal.polimi.it/ 

Skills/Qualifications

The successful candidate is required to have:

  • PhD in at least one of the following subjects:, Electrical and/or Communication and/or Mechanical and/or Biomedical engineering and/or other fields of Engineering, Physics (preferably Optics).
  • Master level degree or equivalent degrees in the field of Electrical and/or Communication and/or Mechanical and/or Biomedical engineering and/or other fields of Engineering, Physics (preferably Optics), or those who have obtained equivalent qualification awarded abroad.
  • Knowledge: optic system, fiber optic sensors, lasers
  • demonstrated record of relevant experience as evidenced by the track-record and publications
  • fluency in English, both spoken and written
  • The candidate should be able to work both independently and interactively in a team setting and possess a noticeable enthusiasm for research.
